article.title: VLA Survey of Dense Gas in Extended Green Objects: Prevalence of 25 GHz Methanol Masers

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following colors represent the 24 μm MIPSGAL contours in Figure 1?
What type of emission is indicated by the magenta × symbols in Figure 1?
choices: 44 GHz Class I CH3OH maser emission

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the typical physical scale represented by 5.0" in Figure 1, assuming a distance of a few kiloparsecs?
Which source in Figure 1 shows clear evidence of multiple 24 μm sources based on morphology?
Which of the following types of emission are NOT detected in Figure 2?
choices: 44 GHz Class I CH3OH maser emission

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the yellow contours in Figure 2 represent?
choices: Sites of 25 GHz CH3OH maser emission
Sites of 44 GHz Class I CH3OH maser emission

multiple_choice_question.text: Which source in Figure 2 exhibits a 1.3 cm continuum morphology suggestive of a possible ionized jet?
What physical process is likely responsible for the extended 4.5 μm emission seen in both sources in Figure 2?
What two main categories of emission are compared in Figure 3?
What spectral feature is present in the spectrum labeled "(C)" in Figure 3, besides thermal emission?
What is the approximate velocity range displayed in each spectrum in Figure 3?
Which of the four CH3OH transitions typically shows the strongest emission in the maser spectra?
What physical property of the EGOs is listed in the second column of Table 1?
What type of maser emission is indicated by a "Y" in the 95 GHz column of Table 1?
Which source in Table 1 has a parallax distance measurement available?
What does a "C" in the "EGO Cat" column of Table 1 indicate?
choices: The EGO was identified in the Chen et al. (2013) catalog
The EGO is coincident with a compact HII region
The EGO is associated with a cluster of young stars

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the "Peak Intensity" column in Table 4 represent?
choices: Peak flux density of the 1.3 cm continuum emission
Peak brightness temperature of the 1.3 cm continuum emission
Peak velocity of the 25 GHz CH3OH emission
Peak integrated flux density of the 25 GHz CH3OH emission

multiple_choice_question.text: What does "unr" in the "Integrated" column of Table 4 indicate?
choices: The integrated flux density is unavailable
The integrated flux density is below the detection limit

multiple_choice_question.text: Which source in Table 4 shows evidence of multiple 1.3 cm continuum components?
What does a "Y" in the "Prior cm-λ Detections?" column indicate?
choices: The source was previously detected at 1.3 cm
The source was previously detected at some other cm wavelength
The source has prior detections of Class I CH3OH masers
The source has prior detections of Class II CH3OH masers

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the "Vpeak" column in Table 5 represent?
choices: Average velocity of all four CH3OH transitions

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of emission is indicated by "Thermal+Abs" in the "Type" column?
choices: Maser emission with a thermal component
Thermal emission with an absorption feature
Maser emission with an absorption feature

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the significance of the "*" symbol following some of the "Fitted Size" values?
choices: The fitted size is poorly constrained, and half the beam size is used as an upper limit
The fitted size is greater than the beam size, indicating resolved emission
The fitted size is smaller than the beam size, indicating unresolved emission
The fitted size is uncertain due to blending with nearby emission

multiple_choice_question.text: What does a dash (-) in the "Flux Densities" columns indicate?
choices: Non-detection of emission in that transition
Uncertain flux density due to dynamic range limitations

multiple_choice_question.text: What criterion is used to determine if 1.3 cm continuum emission is associated with the EGO in Table 6?
choices: Continuum emission must be within the boundary of the 4.5 μm emission
Continuum emission must be within 1" of the peak 4.5 μm emission
Continuum emission must be spectrally coincident with CH3OH emission
Continuum emission must be spatially resolved

multiple_choice_question.text: How many EGOs in Table 6 show evidence of both thermal and maser 25 GHz CH3OH emission?
Which source in Table 6 exhibits thermal 25 GHz CH3OH emission but no 1.3 cm continuum emission associated with the EGO?
What is the overall detection rate of 25 GHz CH3OH emission among the EGOs listed in Table 6?
Which 25 GHz CH3OH transition has the highest median flux density for maser emission in Table 7?
What is the detection rate of the 10(2,8)-10(1,9) transition for thermal CH3OH emission?
What does "S_peak/N" represent in Table 7?
choices: Peak flux density normalized by the source size
Peak flux density normalized by the beam size
Peak flux density divided by the noise level
Integrated flux density divided by the noise level

multiple_choice_question.text: Which type of 25 GHz CH3OH emission (maser or thermal) exhibits a higher median S_peak/N in Table 7?
choices: Cannot be determined from the table
